1.text: Cut a 12-inch (30.48-centimeter) piece of yarn, and set it aside.

2.text: Drape your yarn around your fingers.

3.text: Wrap the yarn around your fingers.

4.text: Carefully pull the yarn off your fingers and set it down on top of your short piece of yarn.

5.text: Tie the yarn tightly around your bundle.

6.text: Turn the bundle over, and tie the yarn into a double knot.

7.text: Trim off the excess yarn, then cut through the loops to either side of the bundle.

10.text: Use a cup to trace a circle onto a piece of cardboard.

11.text: Trace a smaller circle inside the first one.

12.text: Cut the circles out using a craft blade.

13.text: Cut a ½-inch (1.27-centimeter) wide slit into the doughnut.

14.text: Use your doughnut to trace and cut a second one just like it.

15.text: Start wrapping the yarn around your doughnut.

16.text: Keep wrapping the yarn, back and forth, across your doughnut until the center hole is full.

18.text: Cut a long piece of yarn, and tie it around the middle of your yarn bundle.

19.text: Carefully pull the cardboard doughnuts off of your pompom.

21.text: Neaten and even your pompom out.

22.text: Place the end of your yarn horizontally across the prongs of a fork.

23.text: Wrap the yarn around 90 times, then trim the rest off.

25.text: Wrap the short piece of yarn tightly around the wrapped yarn on your fork.

26.text: Tie the short piece of yarn into a tight, double knot.

27.text: Slide the wrapped yarn off of the fork, then snip through the loops on either side.
